data.title: Thai Cravings
data.text: Authentic Thai food that will surely satisfy your cravings. The portion was a bit small for the price so I left hungry and went to another restaurant. Their air conditioning was not working or off during my visit so I was sweating while waiting for my food. They could surely use a kitchen makeover. Although they have a health score of 96 I would question that based on what I saw. All in all not bad but it could be better.

data.title: It's horrible!!
data.text: This place was recommended by our friend & we were eager to try it. We order $40 worth of food and it was all waste. It wasn't worth it at all. The place looked bit unclean, cross contamination was a shock, but owner was nice. The cook lady was using 2 plastic containers for raw food and vegetables  over & over again without washing. This is totally unhygienic. The food smells wired and shrimps had a foul smell. I had to through everything away because food was so HORRIBLE. I saw evaporated milk being used instead of coconut.  We are not going back.

data.title: Looks aren't everything
data.text:
We were walking around downtown Clarksville and came upon this cafe. It's very small and the appearance almost made me not want to eat there. I'm glad we stayed. The pad Thai was very good. You can watch your food being prepared.  My bf had spicy beef and he said it was very spicy, but good.  Will come back here the next time I'm in Clarksville.

This place needs some updating on their decor.  But, its appearance may be what gives it its charm.

data.title: Lunch counter Thai Food... Tasty
data.text: Formerly a burger joint, this eatery has a limited Thai menu (12 items), but what is lacks in the number of dishes is more than off-set by the quality of the food.  The Pad Thai is outstanding and if you want heat, the Spicy Beef (Num Tok Nau) is a great choice.  The owners are a former Air Force vet and his Thai wife.  Ask to see his photos of Thailand.  This is a hole in the wall joint.  It's clean, but you come here for great food, not the atmosphere. Seating may be limited during peak times, but it's worth waiting.

data.title: Fast and QUALITY Thai
data.text: This restaurant calls itself express as it is lunch only, but this is a family run restaurant with delicious Thai food, not some chain Thai express place.  This is right in the heart of downtown Clarkesville; probably the best place to grab lunch therein.

data.title: Tiny but FULL OF FLAVOR!
data.text: Loved eating here for a quick lunch.  It is a small, quaint restaurant decorated with antique cameras and beautiful enlarged pictures of Thailand (I am assuming it is Thailand).  I ordered the stir fried chicken with ginger and my husband ordered the green curry, with spring rolls on the side.  Very yummy!  Then I saw the curry puffs (the other option for side) and ordered one.  I am craving it today!  It really feels like you are eating in somebody's home kitchen, which is fine, not fancy but like I said the food was full of flavor, and authentic tasting.  Will be back soon (maybe even tomorrow just for a quick curry puff or two)  Only accepts Cash so just be aware of that.  Decently priced especially for lunch downtown, and they use good quality ingredients.  Highly Recommend!  Visit their facebook page for their menu.  The lunch special was $7.99 for steamed rice, spring roll or curry puff (both really good!) drink, and something off the menu.
